definition: to spare no effort
(negative prefix)/not/no
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
bitter/hardship/pain/to suffer/to bring suffering to/painstakingly

sentences.english: He spares no pains to study English.
sentences.chinese: 他不辭勞苦地學習英語。

sentences.english: Thank you for the trouble you have taken in sending my son to us.
sentences.chinese: 謝謝你不辭勞苦把兒子送到我們這二。
她工作起來太不辭勞苦了。

sentences.english: He spared neither pains nor expense.
sentences.chinese: 他既不辭勞苦也不惜費用。

definition: to work hard/to look after
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
lit. to thread a needle (idiom); fig. to act as a go-between
to escape (danger)/to rescue/to come out alive
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert a danger (esp. political or medical)
to be reluctant to give up a post
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
diligent and attentive/assiduous/sincere
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
elated and excited (idiom); overjoyed
to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
lit. to cross five passes and slay six generals (idiom)/fig. to surmount all difficulties (on the way to success)
pinyin: guo4 wu3 guan1 zhan3 liu4 jiang4
